channel.title: My Personal Website on Mike Belov
channel.description: Recent content in My Personal Website on Mike Belov

item.title: Image Caption Generation with encoder-decoder neural nets
item.description: In this group research project, I built a CNN+LSTM neural network and experimented with two variations of encoder-decoder models - Merge and Inject. Our models were trained on a 90,000 example subset of Google’s Conceptual Captions dataset on Google Cloud’s VM. Some of the models’ metrics approach state-of-the-art results for the task of image captioning, reaching BLEU-4, METEOR and ROUGE-1 scores of 0.13, 0.14 and 0.2, respectively. Check out this project’s github repository with a complete project report here.

item.title: Spam Detection with Machine Learning
item.description: This time I wanted to explore Enron1 dataset containing spam and non-spam emails and do some Machine Learning modeling for spam detection. Overall, most of the trained models achieved impressive classification results detecting spam >90% of the time with Support Vector Machine being the most optimal model out of the four built on this dataset. Please click here to take a look at some of the visualizations from my EDA & classifiers’ performance metrics analysis.

item.title: Deep Learning for Music Genre Recognition
item.description: Being a bit of a music nerd, I decided to tackle the problem of music genre recognition using deep learning. The key idea was to train a Convolutional Neural Network model on the visual representations of the audio signal (e.g. spectrograms) extracted from the tracks in GTZAN & FMA datasets. I was able to achieve 70% accuracy classifying 10 music genres on a relatively small dataset, which was exciting and definitely worth the effort.
